Chapter 22: The Chapter on No-mind (8)

At that time, there was a bodhisattva named Pure Contemplation who immediately rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, touched his right knee to the ground, knelt for a long time with palms joined, and addressed the Buddha, saying:

At that time, Pure Observation again addressed the Buddha, saying:

If there are good sons and good women who fill the trichiliocosm, each of them building a seven-jeweled stupa, it is not as good as a good son or good woman reciting this Dharma. The merit and blessings of the Dharma necklace are immeasurable.
Why is it so?
All the Buddhas and World-Honored Ones attain accomplishment through this.

If there are good sons and good women who build seven-jeweled stupas filling the trichiliocosm, it is not as good as a good son or good woman upholding and reciting the Dharma necklace practice. The merit and blessings are immeasurable.
At that time, the World-Honored One told Bodhisattva Pure Observation:
Excellent, excellent!
Son of a great clan!
You are able to make the lion's roar in front of the TathÄgata.
How is it?
Son of a great clan!

If there are good sons and good women who uphold and recite this Dharma Ornament, and if there are sentient beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges who perfect the five precepts, would their blessings be many or not?
Pure Vision Bodhisattva said to the Buddha:
Very many, very many!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:

It is not as good as good sons and good women who attain the inexhaustible treasury of the Dharma Ornament. Their merit and blessings are immeasurable, a hundred times, a thousand times, ten thousand times, a myriad times more, and cannot be compared with a metaphor.
Why is it so?
Sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River who perfect the five precepts all attain the fruits of the Way by means of the Dharma Ornament.
The Buddha again told Pure Vision Bodhisattva:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

If there were sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River who attained the five supernatural powers and perfected them all, and further cultivated the five precepts and ten wholesome deeds, would their merit and blessings be many or not?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva addressed the Buddha, saying:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as a good son or good woman who upholds and recites the Dharma adornment practices. The merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is it so?

Sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River all attain the five supernatural powers and each achieves [enlightenment]. It is all due to the Dharma adornment that they are able to fully attain the fruits of the Way.
The Buddha further told Pure Observation Bodhisattva:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

If there were sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River who practiced the four immeasurables - loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity - and practiced the first, second, third, and fourth dhyÄnas, recollecting and upholding joy and peace while guarding oneself, and further practiced the four formless concentrations, each complete, would their merit and blessings be much?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva addressed the Buddha, saying:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
Therefore, it is not as good as good sons and good women upholding and reciting the Dharma adornment practices, the merit and blessings of which are immeasurable.
Why is this?

Sentient beings in a single Ganges river's worth of worlds practice the four immeasurables of kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, cultivate the first, second, third, and fourth dhyanas, mindfully uphold joy and peace, and practice the four formless concentrations, all of which are accomplished through the Dharma adornment and lead to the attainment of various fruits of the path.
The Buddha further told the Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

If sentient beings in a single Ganges river's worth of worlds all attain the fruit of stream-entry, severing all false thoughts, and fully accomplish clear and thorough understanding, would their merit and blessings be much?
The Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation said to the Buddha:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
Therefore, it is not as good as good men and good women upholding and reciting the Dharma adornment practices, whose merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is this?
Sentient beings in a trichiliocosm all attain the path of stream-entry, and each accomplishment is due to the Dharma adornment, by which they attain the fruits of the various paths in their entirety.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Observation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!
If sentient beings in a trichiliocosm all attain the fruit of once-returning, without further doubt and fully accomplished, would their merit and blessings be much?
The Bodhisattva Pure Observation again addressed the Buddha, saying:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as good men and good women upholding and reciting the Dharma adornment practices, whose merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is this?

One Ganges river's worth of sentient beings all attain the fruit of once-returning, each one accomplished without doubt, all due to the Dharma adornments, they attain the complete fruits of the various paths.
The Buddha again told Pure Observation Bodhisattva:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!
If one Ganges river's worth of sentient beings all attain the fruit of non-returning, without further doubt all are accomplished, would their merit and blessings be much?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva again addressed the Buddha, saying:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as a good son or good woman who upholds and recites the Dharma adornments, their merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is it so?

One Ganges river's worth of sentient beings all attain the fruit of non-returning, each one accomplished without doubt, all due to the Dharma adornments, they attain the complete fruits of the various paths.
The Buddha again told Pure Observation Bodhisattva:
What do you think?
Son of a good family!

If there were sentient beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River who all attained the fruit of arhatship, without further doubt and fully accomplished, would their merit and blessings be much?
The Bodhisattva Pure Observation again addressed the Buddha, saying:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as a good son or good woman who upholds and recites the Dharma adornment practices. The merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is it so?

Because sentient beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River all attain arhatship, each fully accomplished without doubt, all due to the Dharma adornment, and thus attain the fruits of the various paths.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Observation:
What do you think?
Son of a good family!
If there were sentient beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River who all attained pratyekabuddhahood, each fully accomplished without doubt, would their merit and blessings be much?
The Bodhisattva Pure Observation addressed the Buddha, saying:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as a good son or good woman who upholds and recites the Dharma adornment practice. The merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is it so?

Sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River all attain pratyekabuddhahood, each accomplishing it without doubt, all due to the Dharma adornment, which enables them to fully attain the fruits of the various paths.
The Buddha again told Purification Bodhisattva:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

If there were sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River who accomplished the first stage of practice, aroused the intention to seek the path, and cultivated the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, would their merit and blessings be much?
Purification Bodhisattva said to the Buddha:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
Therefore, it is not as good as good men and good women upholding and reciting the Dharma adornment practices, whose merit and blessings are immeasurable.

If all beings in a trichiliocosm attain the first ground, arouse the intention to seek the path, cultivate the eighteen dharmas and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and each achieves without doubt, it is all due to the Dharma adornment that they are able to fully attain the fruits of the various paths.

What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

If there are beings in a trichiliocosm who transcend the first ground and abide in the second ground, cultivating the eight dharmas and also cultivating the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, would their merit and blessings be much?

World-Honored One!

What do you think?

If there are sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River who transcend one ground and two grounds and are in the third ground, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplations, practicing the eight dharmas, the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, would their merit and blessings be much?
The Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation said to the Buddha:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
Therefore, it is not as good as the merit and blessings of the sons and daughters of virtuous family who practice the adornment of the Dharma, which is immeasurable.
Why is this?

Because sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River transcend the first stage and the second stage and dwell in the third stage, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplations, as well as cultivating the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, each attaining accomplishment without doubt, all due to the adornment of the Dharma, they are able to fully attain the fruits of the various paths.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation:
What do you think?
Sons and daughters of virtuous family!

If there are sentient beings as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River, from the first stage, the second stage, and the third stage, dwelling in the fourth stage, cultivating the four dharmas and the seven contemplations, as well as the five pure dharmas, practicing the five contemplations, practicing the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, would their merit and blessings be much?
The Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation said to the Buddha:
Very much, very much!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as a good son or good woman who practices the Dharma necklace, whose merit and blessings are immeasurable.
Why is this?

Sentient beings in the fourth ground of the first Ganges river, practicing the four dharmas and seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplated dharmas, practicing the eight dharmas and eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, each accomplished without doubt, all due to the Dharma necklace, and thus able to fully attain the fruits of the Way.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Observation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

If there were sentient beings in the five abodes who cultivated the twelve dharmas with minds unconfused, capable of being taught and practicing the four dharmas and seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas and five contemplations, practicing the eight dharmas and eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, would their merit and blessings be much?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha:
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
It is not as good as the merit and blessings of good sons and good women who adorn themselves with the Dharma, which are immeasurable.
Why is it so?

One Ganges river's worth of sentient beings in the five grounds cultivate the twelve practices with minds free from confusion, able to receive teachings and cultivate the four practices, cultivate the five pure dharmas, practice the five contemplations and the seven contemplations, cultivate the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, each accomplished without doubt, all due to the Dharma adornments, and attain the fruits of the various paths in their entirety.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Observation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!
One Ganges river's worth of sentient beings are all in the sixth ground, practicing the six pÄramitÄs:

Generosity, morality, perseverance, patience, meditation, and wisdom, cultivating the twelve dharmas with an undistracted mind, being able to teach and transform, cultivating the four dharmas and practicing the seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplations, and cultivating the eight dharmas, the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness - would the merit and virtue of that be much?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha,
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said,
It is not as good as a good son or good woman practicing the Dharma adornment, whose merit and virtue are immeasurable.
Why is it so?
Sentient beings in the first asaá¹ƒkhyeya kalpa, while in the six stages, practice the six pÄramitÄs:

Generosity, morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom, cultivating the twelve dharmas suitable for teaching and transforming, as well as cultivating the four dharmas, practicing the seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas, practicing the five contemplations, and cultivating the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the merit and blessings of the adornments of the Dharma and karma are immeasurable. Each is accomplished without doubt, all due to the adornments of the Dharma, and one attains the fruits of the various paths in their entirety.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

Sentient beings in the seven grounds of the first Ganges River, who have attained irreversibility and practice the thirteen dharmas, will firmly accomplish the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, attain the four fearlessnesses, acquire the four kinds of unhindered eloquence, and practice the six pÄramitÄs:

Generosity, morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom, cultivating the twelve factors with an undistracted mind, being able to teach and transform, and cultivating the four dharmas and practicing the seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplations, and cultivating the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness - would the merit and virtue of that be much?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha,
Very much, very much!
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said,
It is not as good as a good son or good woman practicing the Dharma adornment, the merit and virtue of which is immeasurable.
Why is it so?

Sentient beings in the first Ganges river cultivate the four dharmas and practice the seven contemplations, and cultivate the five pure dharmas and practice the five contemplations, and also cultivate the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and attain the stage of nonretrogression. Those who have attained the stage of nonretrogression will definitely attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, attain the four fearlessnesses, and acquire the four kinds of unhindered eloquence, and practice the six pÄramitÄs:

Generosity, morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom, cultivating the twelve dharmas with an undistracted mind, being able to teach and transform, and cultivating the four dharmas and practicing the seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplations, and cultivating the eight dharmas and the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the merit and virtue of the adornments of the Dharma and its activities are immeasurable. Each is accomplished without doubt, all due to the adornments of the Dharma, and one attains the fruits of the various paths in their entirety.
The Buddha further told the Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

Sentient beings in the eight stages in the first Ganges river sands cultivate the practice of youthfulness, accomplish the twelve wonderful dharmas and the five wisdom activities, practice the thirteen dharmas, and with a firm resolve will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, attain the four fearlessnesses and acquire the four kinds of eloquence, and practice the six pÄramitÄs:

Generosity, morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom, cultivating the twelve dharmas with an undistracted mind, being able to teach and transform, and cultivating the four dharmas and practicing the seven contemplations, cultivating the five pure dharmas and practicing the five contemplations, and cultivating the eight dharmas, the eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness - would the merit and virtue of that be much?
Pure Observation Bodhisattva said to the Buddha:
Very much, very much!
The Buddha said:
Therefore, it is not as good as the merit and virtue of the Dharma necklace practice of good sons and good women, which is immeasurable.

One Ganges river's worth of sentient beings in the eighth ground established the practice of youthfulness, accomplished twelve wonderful dharmas, their minds and thoughts were unconfused, they were able to teach and transform, and cultivated four dharmas and practiced seven contemplations, cultivated five pure dharmas and practiced five contemplations, and also cultivated eight dharmas and eighteen dharmas, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the merit and blessings of the adornment of dharmas are immeasurable, each accomplishment is free from doubt, all due to the adornment of dharmas, one attains the complete rewards of the various paths.
The Buddha again told the Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation:
What do you think?
Son of a great clan!

One Ganges river's worth of sentient beings in the ninth ground will certainly firmly abide and attain the immeasurable spiritual virtues of the Buddha, completely abandon all dharmas and no longer cultivate them, and will advance to become Buddhas without ever regressing. The Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation said to the Buddha:ğŸ”½Very many!

World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:

Why is it so?

Sentient beings in the nine grounds in one sand of the Ganges river establish the practice of youthfulness and accomplish the twelve wonderful dharmas, their minds and thoughts are unconfused and they are capable of being taught and transformed. Such beings fill the ten directions of sand in the Ganges river and the first, second, up to the ninth grounds. It is not as good as the adornment of the Dharma by the sons and daughters of a virtuous family, whose merit and blessings are immeasurable. Each and every accomplishment is free from doubt, all due to the adornment of the Dharma, which enables one to fully attain the fruits of the various paths.
At that time, the World-Honored One told Bodhisattva Pure Contemplation:

As for me today, as the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Sole Honored One in the Three Realms, who completely governs the trichiliocosm, I am therefore called the Heaven of Heavens.
This is accomplished through the karma of the Dharma adornments, and its merits and blessings are immeasurable, replete with the profound fruits of the various paths.
At that time, there was a bodhisattva named Bian Tong, who immediately rose from his seat, knelt for a long time with his palms joined, and addressed the Buddha, saying:
If there are good men and good women who wish to cultivate and practice the Dharma adornments with a good and joyful mind, how should they direct their thoughts?
What Dharma should they practice to accomplish the wisdom of the Dharma adornments?
The Buddha said:
Excellent, excellent!
Son of a great clan!

If there are good men and good women who wish to cultivate and practice the Dharma adornments, they should eliminate false thoughts and not give rise to attachment to cognition. With all their thoughts complete, they will attain entry into the various concentrations, and will travel to the innumerable worlds in the ten directions, from one buddha land to another buddha land, serving and making offerings to the buddhas, the World-Honored Ones.
Why is it so?
All of this is due to being free from attachment to concepts, and thus attaining the fruits and rewards of the various paths.
